headline: Paramount Skydance plans bid for Warner Bros Discovery: source
summary: STORY: Paramount Skydance is preparing a bid to buy Warner Bros Discovery.That’s according to a Reuters source on Thursday (September 11).The move could bring together two storied Hollywood studios, and potentially reshape the entertainment industry.It comes only weeks after media production outfit Skydance bought Paramount for over $8 billion.One analyst described the new bid as “a sequel no one expected”.It would bring together some of the best known entertainment brands, ranging from DC Comics superheroes to sci-fi franchises like Star Trek.The deal would also put major news networks CBS and CNN under one roof.Shares in Warner Bros Discovery surged as much as 30% following the initial reports, while Paramount gained 15%.However, the Wall Street Journal says no offer has yet been submitted, and the plans could yet fall apart.Warner Bros Discovery had been planning to split off its declining cable TV business from its studio and streaming units.But the Journal report says the new deal would see Skydance acquire all of the firm’s media assets.The move would reportedly be backed by the Ellison family.That includes Skydance boss David Ellison, and his father, Larry - the multibillionaire founder of Oracle.Legal experts say any takeover would be very likely to face scrutiny by competition watchdogs.

raw.headline: Paramount Skydance plans bid for Warner Bros Discovery: source
raw.summary: STORY: Paramount Skydance is preparing a bid to buy Warner Bros Discovery.That’s according to a Reuters source on Thursday (September 11).The move could bring together two storied Hollywood studios, and potentially reshape the entertainment industry.It comes only weeks after media production outfit Skydance bought Paramount for over $8 billion.One analyst described the new bid as “a sequel no one expected”.It would bring together some of the best known entertainment brands, ranging from DC Comics superheroes to sci-fi franchises like Star Trek.The deal would also put major news networks CBS and CNN under one roof.Shares in Warner Bros Discovery surged as much as 30% following the initial reports, while Paramount gained 15%.However, the Wall Street Journal says no offer has yet been submitted, and the plans could yet fall apart.Warner Bros Discovery had been planning to split off its declining cable TV business from its studio and streaming units.But the Journal report says the new deal would see Skydance acquire all of the firm’s media assets.The move would reportedly be backed by the Ellison family.That includes Skydance boss David Ellison, and his father, Larry - the multibillionaire founder of Oracle.Legal experts say any takeover would be very likely to face scrutiny by competition watchdogs.

headline: Paramount-Warner Deal Would Face Regulatory, Financing Hurdles
summary: Now, the son of Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison is after a bigger prize, the $71 billion Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. If the past few years of tumult in the media industry are a guide, his newly created Paramount Skydance Corp. will face a tortuous path to completing a deal.  A deal will also face financial, operational and investor hurdles, as well as possible interference from President Donald Trump, a frequent target of Paramount’s show this year.  The two companies overlap in a variety of areas: film and TV production, news and cable networks.

raw.headline: Paramount-Warner Deal Would Face Regulatory, Financing Hurdles
raw.summary: Now, the son of Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison is after a bigger prize, the $71 billion Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. If the past few years of tumult in the media industry are a guide, his newly created Paramount Skydance Corp. will face a tortuous path to completing a deal.  A deal will also face financial, operational and investor hurdles, as well as possible interference from President Donald Trump, a frequent target of Paramount’s show this year.  The two companies overlap in a variety of areas: film and TV production, news and cable networks.
